intro: Lavallea ceylanica, commonly known as the Ceylon starling plant, is a climbing shrub native to Sri Lanka. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its twining stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, which are often visited by various pollinators. Its fruits are capsules that release seeds when mature, contributing to its propagation. Due to its ornamental value and ecological role, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and natural habitats.
